H3303.def: = state in which the outward appearance of humans, animals, or objects is pleasing to the eye

H7474.def: = female person who has a special and intimate relationship with another person

H3123.def: = a bird with a blue-gray color with a pinkish sheen to the neck feathers and a black tip on its tail; lives  in large colonies and eats mainly seeds; courts, mates, and has nests several times a year; nests on rock ledges; ◄ |iColumba livia|i*; ► used as food and for sacrifices; ≈ regarded as swift, docile, and innocent, but also as silly and senseless; associated with affection, fertility and sexuality because of its mating habits; the moaning sound this bird sometimes makes is associated with pain and suffering

H1157.def: = path through which a certain entity can be accessed, which can vary from a relatively narrow opening on one side to the entire surrounding space

H6777.def: = gauze-like covering; ► worn over the face, usually by women; ≈ associated with beauty

H8181.def: = the fine thread-like strands growing from the skin of humans and certain animals

H5739.def: = a large group of domesticated mammals that moves and stays together, either in an enclosure or in a open area ◄ usually sheep or goats, but can also include camels or cattle

H5795.def: = a fairly small, female domestic animal, usually black and with floppy ears, hooves and relatively short hair, and usually found in one single {L:flock<SDBH:צֹאן>} with sheep; ► raised for its milk, meat, and skin; a clean animal and therefore to be eaten

H1570.def: exact meaning unsure; possibly: = action by which animals move down from an elevated place by skipping down from one place to another, ≈ which produces an elegant picture

H2022.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H1568.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Makir<SDBH:מָכִיר>}; tribe of {L:Manasseh<SDBH:מְנַשֶּׁה>}; ► settler of the area on the east side of the {L:Jordan<SDBH:יַרְדֵּן>}

H5739.def: = a large group of domesticated mammals that moves and stays together, either in an enclosure or in a open area ◄ usually sheep or goats, but can also include camels or cattle

H7094.def: = causative action by which humans remove part of an object with a sharp tool

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H7367.def: = causative action by which humans wash an animal with water, ► in order to remove any dirt

H8382.def: = causative action by which someone gives birth to twins

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H7909.def: = state in which humans or animals have lost one or more of their offspring

H2339.def: = spun out filament, sometimes dyed scarlet; ◄ of cotton, flax, wool, or another material; ► used as strands for making ropes or for measuring the circumference of objects; ≈ regarded as weak and insignificant

H4057.def: = area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals

H5000.def: = state in which humans or parts of their body are considered physically attractive

H7541.def: = either side of the human head between the forehead and the ear

H1157.def: = path through which a certain entity can be accessed, which can vary from a relatively narrow opening on one side to the entire surrounding space

H6777.def: = gauze-like covering; ► worn over the face, usually by women; ≈ associated with beauty

H6400.def: = a thin, flat piece, cut from a larger portion

H7416.def: = a small tree reaching a height of 3-5 m, with narrow, dark green leaves and thorny branches; its has a red flower and produces red round fruits with a hard skin and tightly-packed pockets of seeds inside; ◄ Punica granatum; ► the seeds can be made into wine; the flower-shaped end of the fruit made it an attractive decoration on stone and in the temple; ≈ associated with love, beauty, and sex

H4026.def: = relatively high structure made of stone; ► used for guarding the surrounding area and/or for providing protection against hostile forces from outside; ≈ associated with security and protection

H1129.def: = causative action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one

H505.def: = generic term for domesticated oxen, both male and female; ► kept for milk and used for plowing

H4043.def: = a flat, usually round, object; made of wood or metal; ► used in battle; held by a warrior in front of him as protection from the weapons of his opponent; relatively small and easy to maneuver; ≈ associated with protection and therefore often used as an epithet for God

H7982.def: = a flat, usually round, object; made of wood or metal; ► used in battle; held by a warrior in front of him as protection from the weapons of his opponent; relatively small and easy to maneuver

H1368.def: = a human being, animal, or supernatural being who is renowned for his characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof

H8147.def: = state in which a countable entity is two in number

H6082.def: = a young male {L:fallow deer<SDBH:אַיָּל>}; ≈ associated with beauty

H8380.def: = two children or young animals born at the same birth

H6646.def: = small to medium sized plain antelope, inhabiting savannah plains and semideserts, reddish brown in color with almost white underparts, and small horns (with exception of female impala); long-legged, graceful, and an expert jumper; lives in small herds; the female is sexually active at one year; high rate of reproduction; ◄ |iGazella dorcas|i* or |iGazella arabica|i*; ► clean and can therefore be eaten; ≈ associated with speed, grace, beauty, female sexuality, male virility, and fertility

H7462.def: = action by which animals are feeding on grass and other edible materials in the field, ≈ often extended to denote the way a king cares for his subjects or the way God cares for his people

H7799.def: = a flowering plant with an erect stem and long narrow leaves; it can grow to 1.5 m high; it has a bulbous root and cone-shaped flowers, usually with 5-6 petals, which protrude straight out or slightly downward from the stem; ◄ Lilium candidum; ► associated with unsurpassed beauty

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H6315.def: = causative action by which deities or forces cause air to blow from one place to another

H5127.def: = action by which humans move to another place in haste, ► in order to escape from a dangerous situation

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H2022.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H4753.def: = the gum of a bush or shrub with thick thorny branches that project and bend at odd angles; its leaves come in sets of three; its fruit is oval like a plum; its wood and bark have a pleasant smell; the gum oozes naturally from the branches; clear or yellowish brown when it comes out, but gets darker as it dries; ◄ Commiphora myrrha, abyssinica, or schimperi; ► an ingredient of anointing oil and perfume; ≈ regarded as precious

H1389.def: = an elevation of the earth’s surface rising gradually and to a relatively small height from the surrounding level; generally lower than a {L:mountain<SDBH:הַר>}

H3828.def: = yellow or reddish gum produced by the Boswellia tree, a shrub that reaches 3 m high, with multiple trunks and small greenish or white flowers; the gum comes out in drops from the branches; ◄ Boswellia sacra; ► ingredient of the incense burned in the tabernacle

6.gl: a breeze starts blowing at the end of the day

H3303.def: = state in which the outward appearance of humans, animals, or objects is pleasing to the eye

H7474.def: = female person who has a special and intimate relationship with another person

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H3971.def: = state in which humans or animals have a physical defect on their body

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3844.def: = range of mountains; ◄ north of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; ► known for the {L:cedar<SDBH:אֶרֶז>} and other trees growing there

H7788.def: = action by which humans move from one place to another

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H8149.def: = mountain, also known as {L:Hermon<SDBH:חֶרְמֹון>}, {L:Sion<SDBH:שִׂיאֹון>}, and {L:Sirion<SDBH:שִׂרְיֹון>}; ◄ part of the Anti-Lebanon range; located north-east of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}

H2768.def: = mountain, also known as {L:Senir<SDBH:שְׂנִיר>}, {L:Sion<SDBH:שִׂיאֹון>}, and  {L:Sirion<SDBH:שִׂרְיֹון>}; ◄ part of the Anti-Lebanon range; located north-east of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}

H4585.def: = a location that deities, humans or animals have made their dwelling place; ≈ associated with security

H2042.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H5246.def: = one of the great cat family of about 2 m in length and of a yellowish brown color with black spots arranged in rosettes all over the body and the tail; ◄ Panthera pardus; ► hunts by stalking prey; ≈ symbol of violent danger

H3823.def: literally: to get heart; hence: = process by which humans learn to think for themselves as opposed to being easily swayed by what others say or do

H269.def: = daughter of one's father, whether from the same mother or not; ≈ sometimes associated with affection; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

H259.def: = state in which a countable entity is one in number

H6060.def: = ornament worn around the neck of people and animals

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H3302.def: = process by which humans or plants develop into a state that is pleasing to the eye

H1730.def: = person for whom one has great affection, often accompanied by sexual desire

H269.def: = daughter of one's father, whether from the same mother or not; ≈ sometimes associated with affection; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

H2895.def: = state in which objects are of a high quality and/or a pleasure to look at

H3196.def: = dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well-being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex{N:001}

H7381.def: = a distinctive smell, which can be perceived as either pleasant or unpleasant; ≈ sometimes associated with the attitude a certain smell evokes in those who perceive it

H8081.def: = high quality {L:oil<SDBH:שֶׁמֶן>}, ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food, medicine, fuel, perfume (when mixed with spices), and other purposes; also used in various religious rituals; ≈ associated with joy, but also known for its softness, smoothness, and elusiveness

H1314.def: = tree of 2-3 meters tall, with small, wrinkled, three-part leaves, white flowers, and pea-sized red berries that have a fragrant yellow seed inside; the bark of younger branches is gray, turning brown with age; it grows in desert or semi-desert climates; ◄ Opobalsamum; ► the tree is wanted for its resin, which appears by itself in green droplets from the stems and branches, but collectors also make cuts in the branches to speed the process; the droplets turn from green to brown, clump together, and fall to the ground, where they are collected; the resin is used in holy anointing oil, as medicine, and as an ingredient of perfume

H5197.def: = process by which liquids flow in small drops

H5317.def: = virgin {L:honey<SDBH:דְּבַשׁ>}, dripping straight from the honeycomb; ≈ regarded as very desirable food of high quality

H1706.def: = sweet substance ◄ made either by bees, or from fruits such as dates, grapes or figs; ► much appreciated as food; ≈ associated with abundance and fertility

H2461.def: = white fluid; ◄ secreted by women and female mammals; ► for nourishment of their children or young; also used as food for humans; ≈ highly appreciated and considered high quality food; associated with delight, whiteness, purity, wealth, and well-being; metaphor for beauty, young age; quality, wealth, and sex

H3956.def: = the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking

H7381.def: = a distinctive smell, which can be perceived as either pleasant or unpleasant; ≈ sometimes associated with the attitude a certain smell evokes in those who perceive it

H8008.def: = a long, flowing outer garment reaching to the feet; it was generally a loose-fitting cloth that was draped around the body and held in place in the middle by a sash wrapped around the waist or some means of fastening such as pins or buttons; it was worn at all levels of society, including also priests and other religious leaders; it served more purposes than just an outer covering; women sometimes carried bowls or other implements or grain in its folds; for poorer people it also served as a covering when sleeping

H3844.def: = range of mountains; ◄ north of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; ► known for the {L:cedar<SDBH:אֶרֶז>} and other trees growing there

H269.def: = daughter of one's father, whether from the same mother or not; ≈ sometimes associated with affection; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

H1588.def: = a fenced portion of land, ► used for growing flowers, plants, and vegetables, but also as a burial place; ≈ associated with beauty and fragrance

H5274.def: = action by which humans secure a door or a lid so that it cannot be opened, ► usually to restrict access to a room or a space

H1530.def: = a ridge of water curling into an arched form between two depressions in open water

H4599.def: = an opening in the earth that gives access to the subterranean water which either comes to the surface or can be drawn from it; ≈ its water is regarded as a source of blessing

H2856.def: = to put a seal on a written document; ► in order to confirm that the document is authentic and to keep unauthorized readers from having access to it; ≈ associated with both authenticity and secrecy

H7973.def: = tool designed to inflict bodily harm, used in armed conflicts

H7416.def: = a small tree reaching a height of 3-5 m, with narrow, dark green leaves and thorny branches; its has a red flower and produces red round fruits with a hard skin and tightly-packed pockets of seeds inside; ◄ Punica granatum; ► the seeds can be made into wine; the flower-shaped end of the fruit made it an attractive decoration on stone and in the temple; ≈ associated with love, beauty, and sex

H4022.def: = object of an extraordinary good quality

H6529.def: = produce from crop-bearing trees and plants

H5373.def: = a leafy bush, less than a meter high, with fragrant-smelling, short stems and a tuft of three narrow leaflets at the tip of each stem; its pink flowers are umbrella-shaped; ► its tubers are pounded to extract a pungent, pale orange or yellow oil; ≈ associated with fragrance

= a leafy bush, less than a meter high, with fragrant-smelling, short stems and a tuft of three narrow leaflets at the tip of each stem; its pink flowers are umbrella-shaped; ► its tubers are pounded to extract a pungent, pale orange or yellow oil; ≈ associated with fragrance

H3750.def: = a plant with tapered grasslike leaves growing from an onion-like bulb under the ground; it has a reddish or purple flower; ◄ Crocus sativus; ► its flower is used for perfume and medicine; ≈ associated with fragrance

H7070.def: = a tall grass with stiff, sharply-pointed leaves and a plume-like flower head that reaches to more than 2 m; it grows in lakes and streams, the roots creeping across the bottom of the lake to produce new leaves and stalks; or on riverbanks; ◄ Phragmites australis (Common reed) or Arundo donax (Giant reed); ► used for baskets, mats, flutes, pens, arrows, and roof-coverings; ≈ symbol of weakness and undependability, but also flexibility

H7076.def: = fragrant substance, ◄ made from the inner bark of the cinnamon tree ► and used for the preparation of perfume and anointing oil

H3828.def: = yellow or reddish gum produced by the Boswellia tree, a shrub that reaches 3 m high, with multiple trunks and small greenish or white flowers; the gum comes out in drops from the branches; ◄ Boswellia sacra; ► ingredient of the incense burned in the tabernacle

H6086.def: = any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit

H4753.def: = the gum of a bush or shrub with thick thorny branches that project and bend at odd angles; its leaves come in sets of three; its fruit is oval like a plum; its wood and bark have a pleasant smell; the gum oozes naturally from the branches; clear or yellowish brown when it comes out, but gets darker as it dries; ◄ Commiphora myrrha, abyssinica, or schimperi; ► an ingredient of anointing oil and perfume; ≈ regarded as precious

H174.def: = large tree which may reach a height of 36 m.; native to south-east Asia and northern India; ◄ Aquilaria ahallocha (agarwood); ► known for its fragrant wood; ≈ associated with fragrance and beauty

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H1314.def: = tree of 2-3 meters tall, with small, wrinkled, three-part leaves, white flowers, and pea-sized red berries that have a fragrant yellow seed inside; the bark of younger branches is gray, turning brown with age; it grows in desert or semi-desert climates; ◄ Opobalsamum; ► the tree is wanted for its resin, which appears by itself in green droplets from the stems and branches, but collectors also make cuts in the branches to speed the process; the droplets turn from green to brown, clump together, and fall to the ground, where they are collected; the resin is used in holy anointing oil, as medicine, and as an ingredient of perfume

H1588.def: = a fenced portion of land, ► used for growing flowers, plants, and vegetables, but also as a burial place; ≈ associated with beauty and fragrance

H4599.def: = an opening in the earth that gives access to the subterranean water which either comes to the surface or can be drawn from it; ≈ its water is regarded as a source of blessing

H875.def: = hole in the ground that reaches underground water; ◄  usually manmade, dug out of the ground, or hewn from rock, but may also be naturally-occurring; ► used for accessing, collecting and storing water; used by shepherds as a source of water for their animals; ≈ regarded  as a source of life because of its water; sometimes used as a metaphor for a woman, possibly based on the physical resemblance of the well to the vagina and its connotation as a source of life

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H5140.def: poetic term; = process by which liquids or odors move from one place to another

H3844.def: = range of mountains; ◄ north of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; ► known for the {L:cedar<SDBH:אֶרֶז>} and other trees growing there

H5782.def: = process by which someone wakes up from his sleep

H6828.def: = a mountain, identified with Jebel ʾel-Aqraʿ ◄ in northern Syria, ► known by the Canaanites as the mountain of the gods

H8486.def: = area located to the south of a point of reference

H6315.def: = causative action by which deities or forces cause air to blow from one place to another

H1588.def: = a fenced portion of land, ► used for growing flowers, plants, and vegetables, but also as a burial place; ≈ associated with beauty and fragrance

H5140.def: poetic term; = process by which liquids or odors move from one place to another

H1314.def: = tree of 2-3 meters tall, with small, wrinkled, three-part leaves, white flowers, and pea-sized red berries that have a fragrant yellow seed inside; the bark of younger branches is gray, turning brown with age; it grows in desert or semi-desert climates; ◄ Opobalsamum; ► the tree is wanted for its resin, which appears by itself in green droplets from the stems and branches, but collectors also make cuts in the branches to speed the process; the droplets turn from green to brown, clump together, and fall to the ground, where they are collected; the resin is used in holy anointing oil, as medicine, and as an ingredient of perfume

H1730.def: = person for whom one has great affection, often accompanied by sexual desire

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H4022.def: = object of an extraordinary good quality

H6529.def: = produce from crop-bearing trees and plants
